definition: lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
ordinary/to use
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to disturb

sentences.english: In fact, most people don't complain frivolously.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，很少人会“庸人自扰”。

sentences.english: It was much ado about nothing.
I would tell myself not to think of it any more.
sentences.chinese: 我会告诉自己，不要再庸人自扰了。

sentences.english: She fusses too much about her health.
sentences.chinese: 她对她的健康有点庸人自扰。

definition: to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
lit. to penetrate into a bull's horn (idiom); fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs
to imagine that one's love is reciprocated/to shower affection on an uninterested party
to deceive others and to deceive oneself/to believe one's own lies
to deceive oneself
mediocre person
to worry about personal gains and losses
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
lit. when the boat gets to the pier-head, it will go straight with the current (proverb)/fig. everything will be all right/cf 車到山前必有路，船到橋頭自然直|车到山前必有路，船到桥头自然直
pinyin: chuan2 dao4 qiao2 tou2 zi4 ran2 zhi2

definition: to be full of remorse/to repent and redress one's errors
to not take to heart/to be free of worried thoughts/to adopt a lighthearted perspective/lighthearted
(idiom) to blame the gods and accuse others
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
to indulge in flights of fancy (idiom)/to let one's imagination run wild
see 胡思亂想|胡思乱想[hu2 si1 luan4 xiang3]
